form.official-title: To provide protections for certain sports medicine professionals who provide certain medical services in a secondary State.

section.header: Protections for covered sports medicine professionals

subsection.text: If a covered sports medicine professional provides covered medical services to an athlete, an athletic team, or a staff member of an athlete or athletic team in a secondary State, such services shall be deemed to have been provided in the primary State for the following purposes:

paragraph.text: Determining the medical professional liability insurance of that professional.
Determining the civil and criminal malpractice liability of that professional.

section.text: In this Act the following definitions apply:

paragraph.text: The term athlete means an individual —

subparagraph.text: competing in a sporting event sponsored or sanctioned by a national governing body; or
for whom an institution of higher education provides a covered sports medicine professional.

paragraph.text: The term athletic team means a sports team—

subparagraph.text: composed of individuals who are paid to participate on the team;
composed of individuals who are competing in a sporting event sponsored or sanctioned by a national governing body; or
for which an institution of higher education provides a covered sports medicine professional.

paragraph.text: The term covered medical services means general medical care, emergency medical care, or athletic training services. Such term does not include care provided by a covered sports medicine professional—

subparagraph.text: at a health care facility; or
while a health care provider legally authorized to practice in the secondary State is transporting the injured individual to a health care facility.

paragraph.text: The term covered sports medicine professional means a physician or athletic trainer who—

subparagraph.text: is legally authorized to practice in the primary State;

provides covered medical services, pursuant to a written agreement with an athletic team, national governing body, or institution of higher education, to an individual who is a member or staff of the athletic team; and

prior to providing the covered medical services described in subparagraph (B), has disclosed the nature and extent of such services to the entity that provides the physician or athletic trainer with medical professional liability insurance in the primary State.

paragraph.text: The term health care facility means a facility in which medical care, diagnosis, or treatment is provided on an inpatient or outpatient basis. Such term does not include facilities at an arena or stadium or temporary facilities existing for events where athletic teams are competing.
The term institution of higher education has the meaning given such term in section 101 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001).
The term national governing body has the meaning given such term in section 220501 of title 36, United States Code.
The term primary State means the State in which the covered sports medicine professional is legally authorized to practice.
The term secondary State means any State in which the covered sports medicine professional is not legally authorized to practice.
The term State means each of the several States, the District of Columbia, and each commonwealth, territory, or possession of the United States.
